importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when the Blue Jays defeated the Mariners in Game 6 of the ALCS, advancing to Game 7 and setting up a potential World Series matchup.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The immediate post-game period when the winner of Game 7 would face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, beginning on Friday, October 24, 2025.

keyTakeAways: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run in the postseason, contributing to a 6-2 victory over the Seattle Mariners.
The Blue Jays' win forces a Game 7 in the ALCS, the first time the Mariners have played such a decisive game in history.
Seattle's season-high three errors, including two in the second inning, significantly contributed to the Blue Jays' early lead.
The game marked the Blue Jays' first Game 7 since 1985 and their second in franchise history.
Toronto’s victory advances them to face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series.
Mariners’ pitcher Yesevage showed strong composure, throwing a season-high 31 splitters and allowing only six hits and three walks.
The Blue Jays' momentum and performance highlight the significance of defensive mistakes and individual player resilience in playoff outcomes.

namedEntities.name: Yesevage

summaryOfNewsArticle: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run of the postseason, helping the Toronto Blue Jays defeat the Seattle Mariners 6-2 to force a decisive Game 7 in the American League Championship Series. The Mariners committed three critical errors, including two in the second inning, which led to early scoring and a significant deficit. Despite a run by Josh Naylor in the sixth, the Blue Jays’ momentum was preserved with a wild pitch from Matt Brash in the seventh that allowed Guerrero to score, extending the lead to 6-2. The win marks the Blue Jays’ first Game 7 since 1985 and the Mariners’ first such scenario in history. The winner will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday, October 24, 2025.
title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits sixth homer of postseason as Blue Jays dominate Mariners to force ALCS Game 7
